page.title: 04Southwell's Wells
page.content: { The House of Correction}was built in 1803. It is now used for a lorry company, little remains of{The House {of Correction.}Only the gatehouse is left standing.{The House of Correction was last used in the 19th century. There are four special{wells}in {Southwell. St. Catherine's Well, Holy {Well,Lord's Well,}and the{Lady's Well. {St.Catherine's Well}is supposed to cure{rheumatism. The Lady' Well}was covered up in 1746 because one night a man called Mr.Fowler was taking a short cut home through the churchyard. It was very dark and he could not see where the well was and suddenly he fell down the well. From that day onwards the well has been covered. The{Minster church}is an old church with a mixture of{Norman}and{Saxon {architecture
